action.action-desc: Mr. Takano introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to create fact sheets, for veterans and for survivors of veterans, that compare benefits and compensation, to such individuals under laws administered by the Secretary, to monthly insurance benefits under title II of the Social Security Act, and to supplemental security income under title XVI of the Social Security Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Information on Federal Resources for Military Servicemembers Act or the INFORMS Act .

section.header: Fact sheets regarding VA and Social Security benefits and compensation

subsection.text: Not later than six months after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, after consultation with the Commissioner of the Social Security Administration and stakeholders (including veterans service organizations), shall create fact sheets, one for veterans and one for survivors of deceased veterans, that compares, for such individuals—

paragraph.text: benefits and compensation (including a pension) under laws administered by the Secretary;
monthly insurance benefits under title II of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 401 et seq.); and
supplemental security income under title XVI of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1381 et seq.).

subsection.text: A fact sheet created under subsection (a) shall include, with respect to such benefits and compensation, monthly insurance benefits, and supplemental security income, the following:

paragraph.text: Sources of additional information or assistance in applications.

subsection.text: Not later than three months after creating a fact sheet under subsection (a), the Secretary shall provide a copy thereof to an individual whenever the Secretary—

subparagraph.text: an initial claim for a benefit or compensation; or
a claim for an increase to a benefit or compensation; or

paragraph.text: notifies such individual that the Secretary has denied a claim for, or decreased the amount of, a benefit or compensation.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall update a fact sheet created under subsection (a), to reflect amendments to laws described in such subsection, not less than once annually.
